Instruction: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Make the dough: Cut 1/2 cup of butter into 1 cup of flour using a knife or pastry cutter. Add 1 tablespoon of water (or adjust as necessary) and mix until the mixture is crumbly, with pea-sized pieces remaining. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a width of 3 or 4 inches. Transfer it onto a rectangular cookie sheet.

Make the filling: In a small saucepan over high heat, combine 1 cup water and 1/2 cup butter and bring to a boil. Take it off the heat and mix in the remaining 1 cup flour until smooth. Incorporate the eggs one by one, ensuring to mix well after each addition. Stir in 1 teaspoon of almond extract. Spread the filling over the dough.
Bake in the preheated oven for 55 to 60 minutes. The pastry will slightly sink as it cools.
Stir until smooth and drizzle over the cooled pastry.
Allow the icing to set before slicing and serving.
